discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
3 controllers for HA, only 1 fail, check the course materials

Selected Answer: C
I would go for answer C since "High Availability of multi-instance management functionality is only possible when exactly three controllers are in the federation."
Answer is B (1) as there is only a max of 3 in HA so only 1 can fail which leaves 2 for quorum
Answer D

questions.question_text: What is the number of SDDC Manager controller instances that can fail in a highly available VMware Cloud Foundation federation?

choices.D: Use the bundle transfer utility to download the bundles and manually upload to SDDC Manager.
choices.C: Ask the network team to temporarily allow direct access to the internet from SDDC Manager.
choices.A: Configure proxy on SDDC Manager and download binaries directly from SDDC Manager GUI.
choices.B: Use vRealize Suite Lifecycle Manager to download binaries and upload to SDDC Manager.

discussion.content: If no access for SDDC , D is the option, tricky question,
D best answer. A is possible however VMware Cloud Foundation only supports proxy servers that do not require authentication. So D would be a more suitable answer

Selected Answer: A
Bot A and D are possible, but A looks like the best answer since the question mentions "The administrator wants to use SDDC Manager to automate as many tasks as possible". Option D requires more manual interventions.
The statement says that SDDC manager does not have direct internet access. IT means can be use vis proxy. Hence correct answer for this question is "A"

Selected Answer: D

Which action should the administrator take to perform the upgrade?

questions.question_text: Which role is required to commission new hosts in SDDC Manager following the principle of least privilege?

choices.C: Use a VMware assisted backup solution to restore the SDDC Manager
choices.B: Deploy a new SDDC Manager from the management vCenter server
choices.A: Import any file-level backup to a new deployment of SDDC Manager
choices.E: Use the SoS Utility to restore the SDDC Manager configuration
choices.D: Use the restore utility in the old SDDC Manager to restore the file-level backup

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
training materials.
A & B are the right answers.

Selected Answer: AB
Answer is
A. Import any file-level backup to a new deployment of SDDC Manager
B. Deploy a new SDDC Manager from the management vCenter server
